antichess
Class GameDescriptor

java.lang.Object
  antichess.GameDescriptor

public class GameDescriptor
extends Object

A GameDescriptor is an immutable ADT that stores the information required for generating a new game. Fields store by the GameDescriptor:

Specification Fields
  • gameTypeName //String which describes the type of game played
  • players //List which lists all the Players playing the game
  • playerDescriptions //List which describes the type of player for each
  • playerTimes //long[] which contains the total amount of playing time for each player //0 means the player is not timed.
  • allowSaveLoad //boolean as to whether saving and loading are allowed Acceptable values for the fields (space delineated) For gameTypeName : Chess Antichess TextAntichess For players : WHITE BLACK For playerDescription : Human AI TextHuman TextAI For playerTimes : all values must be >= 0 For allowSaveLoad : true false Attempting to create a GameDescriptor with something other than these values will cause it to throw an IllegalArgumentException Values indexed by the same number in players, playerDescriptions, and playerTimes describe the same player. All of these sequences must be the same size. The times stored in playerTimes represent the amount on the timer in milliseconds.
